TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at TIME , the applicant went to FAC to cash his DATE sickness benefit . Having noticed that the sum cashed was smaller than the amount he had received in DATE he expressed dissatisfaction to the mayor and the deputy mayor .

CARDINAL . Unsatisfied with the explanations received , the applicant started to insult the civil servants working at the town hall . A few of the witnesses to the incident stated that the applicant was under the influence of alcohol . The applicant denied it .
CARDINAL . As the applicant could not be calmed down , the mayor and the deputy mayor took him to the police station , which was situated close to the town hall .
CARDINAL . The applicant alleged that the mayor had hit him at the police station . He did not submit any medical certificate in this connection .

CARDINAL . On the ground that the applicant continued to behave aggressively and to address threats to those around him , the chief police officer , GPE , handcuffed him to a tree in the courtyard of the police station .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant and several witnesses , he was kept handcuffed for TIME and TIME . The Government averred that the handcuffing lasted TIME and TIME .

CARDINAL . As the police station was located in the centre of the village , many inhabitants of the village passed by and saw the applicant handcuffed to the tree in the courtyard . CARDINAL of them informed the press and the local television station . Reporters arrived at the scene and took pictures of the handcuffed applicant . The incident was covered by an article on DATE in the local newspaper ORG called ‘ The chief police officer of PERSON molests a fellow PERSON .

CARDINAL . DATE before the events in question , the applicant had had surgery on his left femur . According to the documents submitted by him , he was hospitalised in the orthopaedics section of ORG DATE and DATE and DATE and DATE . At the time of the events he was suffering from coxarthrose ( arthritis of the hip ) and was receiving sickness benefit for that reason .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , being kept handcuffed outdoors for such a long time on a cold and wet DATE worsened his medical condition . On the basis of a medical certificate issued on DATE the applicant had been designated disabled ( at medium level ) by a medical board .

CARDINAL . On DATE the incident took place , police officer GPE drafted a report stating that he had had to use force and the handcuffs in order to prevent the applicant from deliberately self - harming . He stated that he had kept the applicant handcuffed for TIME and that he had stayed close to him all this time . However , his statement was contradicted by the statement of GPE , the former deputy mayor of the village , who testified that the applicant was alone and the police station was closed when he passed by the front of the building on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a criminal complaint with ORG against police officer GPE and the mayor , accusing them of causing bodily harm and insulting behaviour .

CARDINAL . By a judgment rendered on DATE , that court remitted the file to the prosecutor ’s office attached to ORG for investigation of the incident . It gave a new legal classification to the offences mentioned in the applicant ’s complaint , namely abuse of position and deprivation of liberty .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office attached to ORG decided not to open a criminal investigation , on the grounds that it was permissible to handcuff an aggressive person .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged another criminal complaint against the chief police officer , the deputy chief police officer , the mayor and the deputy mayor . He accused them of deprivation of liberty ( under LAW ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made a statement at the prosecutor ’s office . He stated that he had not been hit by any of the defendants , as he had stated in his initial complaint . He added that he had been persuaded to lodge a criminal complaint by the previous mayor , by a member of the local council of the village , and by the president of an organisation fighting against corruption and for the protection of human rights ( PERSON , PERSON – ORG ) . He also stated that he had been handcuffed for TIME and that it was legitimate , taking into account his own behaviour . He concluded by stating that he wanted to withdraw his complaint . Afterwards , during the proceedings before the courts , the applicant alleged that he had been forced to make that statement and that nothing in it was true .

CARDINAL . By a decision delivered on DATE , the prosecutor ’s office attached to ORG decided not to open a criminal investigation . It held that police officer GPE had taken the necessary measures in order to calm down the applicant , who was using coarse language and insulting the civil servants working at the town hall , and was behaving in an especially insulting way towards the mayor of the village . It also held that handcuffing the applicant was in accordance with the provisions of Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL regarding the organisation and functioning of the NORP police ( “ ORG Act DATE ” ) , and Order no . CARDINAL of DATE regarding ORG . It stated that the applicant had not been hit by any police officers .

CARDINAL . Relying on Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure , the applicant lodged complaints against the decisions of DATE and DATE . The CARDINAL complaints were joined by the chief prosecutor . On DATE the chief prosecutor dismissed the complaints and upheld the previous decisions .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s complaint against the last prosecutor ’s decision was dismissed by ORG on DATE . It held that the immobilising of the applicant with handcuffs in the courtyard of the police station had been done in accordance with the applicable legislation , and had been necessary , taking into account the applicant ’s attitude .
CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law lodged by the applicant was dismissed by ORG on DATE , upholding the judgment of the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office attached to GPE ORG indicted the applicant for outrage against public morals and disturbance of public order under LAW .

CARDINAL . By a judgement of DATE , ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment , suspended . The judgment remained final , as the applicant did not lodge an appeal on points of law .
CARDINAL . The definition of the offence of outrage against public morals and disturbance of public order was , at the material time , provided for by LAW and read as follows :

“ Actions by a person who publicly acts or makes gestures , uses words or expressions , or behaves in any other way which is against public morals or which leads to public scandal , are punishable by imprisonment of DATE or by a fine .
If the actions stipulated in paragraph CARDINAL seriously disturb public order , the applicable penalty shall be imprisonment of DATE . ”
CARDINAL . The conditions regarding the use of handcuffs by police officers are provided for by ORG Act DATE . The relevant articles read as follows :

( CARDINAL ) “ In order to deter , prevent and neutralise aggressive behaviour by people who disturb public order and which can not be brought to an end by other means , police can use protective shields , helmets , rubber truncheons ( ... ) rubber bullet guns and handcuffs , dogs and other means of restraint which do not endanger life or cause serious bodily harm .
( CARDINAL ) The means referred to in the above paragraph may be used against people who :
a ) NORP behave in such a way as to threaten the physical integrity , health or property of others ;

b ) try to enter , enter or refuse to leave the premises of public authorities , political parties , institutions and public or private organisations , jeopardise in any way their integrity or security or prevent them from carrying out their normal activity ;
c ) Insult or attack those who are exercising public functions ;

d ) Offer resistance or fail to comply , in any way , with the orders of a police officer , but only if there is a legitimate fear that by their actions they could jeopardise the physical integrity or the life of that police officer .
( CARDINAL ) The use of the means described under the first paragraph must not exceed the level necessary to prevent or neutralise the aggressive behaviour . ”

“ The use of the means provided by ORG and DATE is prohibited against women with visible signs of pregnancy , against persons with visible evidence of disability and against children , except in cases when they engage in armed attack or in a group , which poses a threat to the life or the integrity of CARDINAL or more people . ”
